input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved.
outdir.help_text: All the outputs will be stored under this directory. Sub-folders for each dataset will be written in this folder using reads basenames. Short reads basenames for short reads only assemblies and long reads basenames for hybrid and long reads only assemblies.

longreads.description: Path to input long reads (ONT or Pacbio) in fastq
longreads.help_text: This sets path to the input longreads. It is required for longreads-only or hybrid assemblies.

lr_type.description: Tells whether input longreads are: pacbio or nanopore.
lr_type.help_text: Your long reads are from pacbio or nanopore sequencing platforms?

wtdbg2_technology.description: Set  correct long reads technology specification for wtdbg2
wtdbg2_technology.help_text:
When assembling pacbio long reads with wtdbg2, it is necessary to tell the pipeline whether reads are "rs" for PacBio RSII, "sq" for PacBio Sequel, "ccs" for PacBio CCS reads.

This parameter defaults to ont, such it is required to change when using pacbio reads.

corrected_lreads.description: Tells the pipeline to interpret the long reads as "corrected" long reads.
corrected_lreads.help_text: This will activate (if available) the options for corrected reads in the assemblers: -corrected (in canu), --pacbio-corr|--nano-corr (in flye), etc. Be cautious when using this parameter. If your reads are not corrected, and you use this parameter, you will probably do not generate any contig.

shortreads_paired.description: Path to input paired end short reads in fastq
shortreads_paired.help_text:
This sets path to the input paired end short reads. It is required for shortreads-only or hybrid assemblies.
Users must use the following notation: "path/to/dir/pattern_{1,2}.fastq". It can be gzipped or not.
The \*{1,2}\* regex is required so that nextflow can properly load the exact read pairs. Read more [in their manual](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/channel.html#fromfilepairs).

shortreads_single.description: Path to input unpaired short reads in fastq
shortreads_single.help_text: This sets path to the input unpaired short reads. It is required for shortreads-only or hybrid assemblies.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.

threads.description: Number of threads to use for each process

parallel_jobs.description: Number of jobs to run in parallel. Each job can consume up to N threads (--threads)

cpus.description: Number of cores to run nanopolish in parallel

strategy_2.help_text: This paremeter tells the pipeline to first create a longreads-only assembly and then polish it with short reads, instead of executing the hybrid assembly modes implemented by Unicycler, Haslr and SPAdes.

pilon_memory_limit.description: Max amount of memory allocated by Pilon (in gigabase)
pilon_memory_limit.help_text: Whenever polishing long reads only assemblies with unpaired short reads (single end), the pipeline will directly execute one round of pilon polishing instead of using Unicycler's polish pipeline. Therefore we need to allocate the amount of memory allocated by Pilon. Default 50G. This step is crucial because with not enough memory will crash and not correct your assembly. When that happens you will not have the pilon output nor the QUAST assessment.

turn_assemblers_on_off.title: Turn assemblers on/off
turn_assemblers_on_off.description: Select which assemblers to skip or not

skip_spades.help_text: SPAdes is a short reads only and hybrid assembler.

skip_shovill.help_text: Shovill is a paired short reads only assembler.

skip_unicycler.help_text: Unicycler is a short reads only, long reads only and hybrid assembler.

skip_canu.help_text: Canu is a long reads only assembler. Can be use for hybrid assemblies in strategy 2.

skip_flye.help_text: Flye is a long reads only assembler. Can be use for hybrid assemblies in strategy 2.

skip_raven.help_text: Raven is a long reads only assembler. Can be use for hybrid assemblies in strategy 2.

skip_wtdbg2.help_text: wtdbg2 is a long reads only assembler. Can be use for hybrid assemblies in strategy 2.

skip_shasta.help_text: Shasta is a long reads only assembler. Can be use for hybrid assemblies in strategy 2.

genomeSize.help_text: It sets the expected genome size of the assembly. It is required by Canu and Haslr assemblers. It is optional for Flye, but highly recommended. E.g. 5.6m; 1.2g.

software_additional_parameters.title: Software' additional parameters
software_additional_parameters.description: Pass additional parameters to the software

quast_additional_parameters.help_text:
Give additional parameters to Quast while assessing assembly metrics. 
Must be in quotes and separated by spaces.
Must be given as shown in Quast manual. E.g. " --large --eukaryote ".

shovill_additional_parameters.help_text: Passes additional parameters for Shovill assembler. E.g. '--depth 15 --assembler skesa'. Must be given as shown in Shovill’ manual.

spades_additional_parameters.help_text: Passes additional parameters for SPAdes assembler. E.g. '–meta –plasmids'. Must be given as shown in Spades’ manual.

unicycler_additional_parameters.help_text: Passes additional parameters for Unicycler assembler. E.g. '–mode conservative –no_correct'. Must be given as shown in Unicycler’s manual.

haslr_additional_parameters.help_text: Passes additional parameters for Haslr assembler. E.g. '--cov-lr 30'. Must be given as shown in Haslr’ manual.

canu_additional_parameters.help_text: Passes additional parameters for Canu assembler. E.g. 'correctedErrorRate=0.075 corOutCoverage=200'. Must be given as shown in Canu’s manual.

flye_additional_parameters.help_text: Passes additional parameters for Flye assembler. E.g. '–meta –iterations 4'. Must be given as shown in Flye’s manual.

raven_additional_parameters.help_text: Passes additional parameters for Raven assembler. E.g. '--polishing-rounds 4'. Must be given as shown in Raven’ manual.

wtdbg2_additional_parameters.help_text: Must be given as shown in wtdbg2 manual. E.g. " --tidy-reads 5000 ", inside quotes and separated by spaces.

shasta_additional_parameters.help_text: Must be given as shown in shasta manual. E.g. " --Reads.minReadLength 5000 ", inside quotes and separated by spaces

long_reads_assembly_polishing_parameters.title: Long reads assembly polishing parameters
long_reads_assembly_polishing_parameters.description: Select which long reads assembly polishers to use. They can be also used with hybrid assemblies in strategy 2, see the docs.

medaka_sequencing_model.help_text:
Useful for longreads-only or hybrid assemblies using strategy 2.
Used to polish a longreads-only assembly with Medaka. It selects a Medaka ONT sequencing model for polishing. Please read [medaka manual](https://nanoporetech.github.io/medaka/) for more instructions.

Models Available: r103_min_high_g345, r103_min_high_g360, r103_prom_high_g360, r103_prom_snp_g3210, r103_prom_variant_g3210, r10_min_high_g303, r10_min_high_g340, r941_min_fast_g303, r941_min_high_g303, r941_min_high_g330, r941_min_high_g340_rle, r941_min_high_g344, r941_min_high_g351, r941_min_high_g360, r941_prom_fast_g303, r941_prom_high_g303, r941_prom_high_g330, r941_prom_high_g344, r941_prom_high_g360, r941_prom_high_g4011, r941_prom_snp_g303, r941_prom_snp_g322, r941_prom_snp_g360, r941_prom_variant_g303, r941_prom_variant_g322, r941_prom_variant_g360
Default consensus:  r941_min_high_g360

nanopolish_fast5Path.description: Polish with Nanopolish? Set path to dir with fast5 data.
nanopolish_fast5Path.help_text:
Useful for longreads-only or hybrid assemblies using strategy 2.
Used to polish a longreads-only assembly with Nanopolish. It sets path to the directory containing all the FAST5 files containing the raw data.

nanopolish_max_haplotypes.description: Max. number of haplotypes to be considered by Nanopolish
nanopolish_max_haplotypes.help_text:
Useful when polishing the genome with Nanopolish (--nanopolish_fast5Path).
It sets the max number of haplotypes to be considered by Nanopolish. Sometimes the pipeline may crash because to much variation was found exceeding the limit.

pacbio_bams.description: Loads all the subreads *.bam pacbio raw files for polishing with gcpp
pacbio_bams.help_text:
This parameter loads all the subreads *.bam pacbio raw files for polishing with gcpp.
In order to nextflow properly use it, one needs to store all the data, from all the cells in one single directory and set the filepath as "some/data/*bam".
